resources.string: The Game of Life, also known simply as Life, is a cellular automaton devised by the British mathematician John Horton Conway in 1970. It is the best-known example of a cellular automaton.
This will set the screen to Initial Pattern setting.
Any live cell with fewer than the \'Underpopulate Number\' of live neighbours dies, as if by under-population
Any live cell with more than the \'Overpopulate Number\' of live neighbours dies, as if by over-population
Any dead cell with \'Spawn Number\' of live neighbours becomes alive

Many different types of patterns occur in the Game of Life, including still lifes, oscillators, and patterns that translate themselves across the board, including the glider, discovered by Richard K. Guy in 1970, and several kinds of spaceships. (Works only with default game rules.)
Change the size of the grid.
Grid is cleared as Gosper Glider Gun is not supported in the current grid size. Select a larger grid from settings.
Change the background color of the grid.
Change the color of the cell.
